title: What is Image Processing?
description:
📌 Manipulating and analyzing images to extract useful information.
✅ Used in medical imaging, computer vision, and multimedia.
🔍 Example: Enhancing satellite images for weather forecasting.
👉 Where have you encountered image processing in daily life?

title: Types of Image Processing
description:
📌 Digital vs. Analog Image Processing.
✅ Digital: Computer-based manipulation (e.g., Photoshop, AI-based enhancement).
✅ Analog: Optical and film-based processing.
🔍 Example: Old photo negatives developed using chemical processing.
👉 Can you think of a scenario where analog processing is still used?

title: Image Representation: Pixels & Resolution
description:
📌 Images are grids of pixels with color or grayscale values.
✅ Higher resolution means more details but larger file size.
🔍 Example: 1080p vs. 4K resolution in TVs.
👉 How does resolution affect image clarity in different applications?

title: Color Spaces: RGB vs. CMYK
description:
📌 Different ways to represent colors in an image.
✅ RGB (Red-Green-Blue) for screens, CMYK (Cyan-Magenta-Yellow-Black) for printing.
🔍 Example: Monitors use RGB, but printers convert it to CMYK.
👉 Have you noticed color differences between digital screens and prints?

title: Grayscale & Binary Images
description:
📌 Simplified images with fewer color values.
✅ Grayscale: 0 (black) to 255 (white), used in medical scans.
✅ Binary: Only black & white, useful for OCR and edge detection.
🔍 Example: QR codes and barcode scanning.
👉 Where else have you seen binary images in use?

title: Image Histogram
description:
📌 Graph showing the distribution of pixel intensities.
✅ Helps in contrast enhancement and thresholding.
🔍 Example: Auto-adjusting brightness in smartphone cameras.
👉 Have you used histogram adjustments in editing software?

title: Image Filtering: Smoothing & Sharpening
description:
📌 Used to enhance image quality.
✅ Smoothing (Blur) reduces noise, Sharpening highlights edges.
🔍 Example: Instagram filters that smooth skin or sharpen details.
👉 Which type of filter do you use most in editing?

title: Edge Detection: Sobel & Canny
description:
📌 Finding boundaries of objects in an image.
✅ Sobel: Basic edge detection, Canny: Advanced multi-stage process.
🔍 Example: Face recognition and license plate detection.
👉 Where have you seen edge detection applied?

title: Morphological Operations in Image Processing
description:
📌 Used in binary image processing for shape manipulation.
✅ Erosion: Removes small objects, Dilation: Fills gaps.
🔍 Example: Cleaning up scanned documents for OCR.
👉 Can you think of another application of these techniques?

title: Thresholding & Binarization
description:
📌 Converting grayscale images into black and white.
✅ Used in text recognition and image segmentation.
🔍 Example: Extracting text from scanned documents.
👉 Have you ever converted an image to pure black & white?

title: Fourier Transform in Image Processing
description:
📌 Converts images from spatial to frequency domain.
✅ Helps in noise reduction and watermarking.
🔍 Example: JPEG compression uses Fourier Transform.
👉 Have you heard of frequency-based image compression before?

title: Image Compression: Lossy vs. Lossless
description:
📌 Reducing image file size.
✅ Lossy: JPEG (removes some data, smaller file).
✅ Lossless: PNG (keeps all data, larger file).
🔍 Example: JPEG for photos, PNG for logos with transparency.
👉 Which format do you use most for saving images?

title: Image Segmentation: Region-Based vs. Edge-Based
description:
📌 Splitting an image into meaningful parts.
✅ Region-based: Groups similar pixels, Edge-based: Detects boundaries.
🔍 Example: Self-driving cars detecting road lanes and obstacles.
👉 Can you think of another area where segmentation is used?

title: Convolution in Image Processing
description:
📌 Applying filters (kernels) to transform an image.
✅ Used in blurring, sharpening, and feature extraction.
🔍 Example: Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) in AI-based vision.
👉 Have you seen AI-based image enhancement in action?

title: Machine Learning in Image Processing
description:
📌 AI-powered image recognition and enhancement.
✅ Used in medical imaging, facial recognition, and autonomous vehicles.
🔍 Example: Google Lens identifying objects in real time.
👉 How do you think AI will change image processing in the future?

title: Image Restoration vs. Enhancement
description:
📌 Restoration: Removing distortions (e.g., noise, motion blur).
✅ Enhancement: Improving quality (e.g., increasing sharpness, contrast).
🔍 Example: Restoring old damaged photographs.
👉 Have you ever restored an old photo digitally?

title: Optical Character Recognition (OCR)
description:
📌 Converting scanned images of text into digital text.
✅ Used in document scanning and license plate recognition.
🔍 Example: Google Translate using OCR for real-time translations.
👉 Have you used OCR tools to extract text from images?

title: Super-Resolution Imaging
description:
📌 Enhancing image resolution beyond its original quality.
✅ AI-powered methods create sharper images.
🔍 Example: Zooming into blurry CCTV footage.
👉 Have you seen AI-based upscaling in action?

title: Face Detection & Recognition
description:
📌 Identifying faces in images.
✅ Used in security, social media, and biometric authentication.
🔍 Example: Face unlock feature in smartphones.
👉 How do you feel about facial recognition technology?

title: Deepfake Technology in Image Processing
description:
📌 AI-generated realistic but fake images/videos.
✅ Uses deep learning and GANs (Generative Adversarial Networks).
🔍 Example: Celebrity face swaps in viral videos.
👉 What are the ethical concerns surrounding deepfakes?
